text: “Pants to Brexit” and other great home-made signs #PutItToThePeopleMarch #PeoplesVote
author: wdjstraw

text: See for yourself on this extraordinary BBC aerial film of the entire march from Park Lane to Parliament Sq: https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-47678763 …
author: wdjstraw

text: #RevokeArticle50 is the fastest growing House of Commons petition ever.
author: wdjstraw

text: Or what if they relent and we spend another 8 weeks mucking about without resolution. Would the EU countenance another extension? Essentially unless May resigns, calls an election/referendum or gets serious about Customs Union, we will crash out one way or another.
author: wdjstraw

text: Of course I was qualified. I wouldnt have applied otherwise. You'd have to ask Peter Mandelson, Damian Green, Danny Alexander & Roland Rudd why they appointed me over someone else.
author: wdjstraw

text: I stepped up when no-one else wanted to do the job. If we'd had a Conservative leader who understood emotional campaigning & a Labour leader who wanted to Remain, we would have won.
author: wdjstraw

text: Take back control, they said. But today, we go BEGGING to the EU to get us out of this mess. May’s incompetence has made things very much worse. But @BorisJohnson @michaelgove & the rest started this with their lies & false promises. Your mess. We won’t forget. #PeoplesVote
author: wdjstraw

text:
Scary 

Trump massively outspending the Democrat field on Facebook & Google ads. (via @axios)
author: wdjstraw

text: I’d say 20 is top end of MPs who will actually defy the whip and risk wrath of both Momentum & Moderate members.
author: wdjstraw

text: I agree with both of you. But it does show - as @rbrharrison says - that this is another opp for the EU to extract concessions & another indication of how woeful this whole “negotiation” has been.
author: wdjstraw

text: This is very worrying. Article 50 extension requires unanimity so anyone of these countries could veto - even though it would be calamitous for us and them.
author: wdjstraw

text: I am voting for @ryangrant01 in @TheFBAs for #BestEstablishedCreator
author: wdjstraw

text: A risible comparison. My comments were in context of Farage’s “Breaking Point” poster so entirely accurate & justified. Only a campaign capable of that tone would stoop so low & breach the agreement to suspend campaigning that awful weekend.
author: wdjstraw

text:
Most laughable news of the day (via @Jack_Blanchard_ ) is that No 10
Chief of Staff Gavin Barwell has been discussing next week’s “narrative” with Cabinet Ministers.
Simples:
- You’re fucked
- May’s red lines got us here
- #PeoplesVote is the only route out of this.
author: wdjstraw

text: As ever @DavidLammy is spot on. These tired images are also counterproductive. This research @leniwild @Alex_Glennie & I did in 2012 showed how these fundraising appeals reinforce a view that nothing is changing & therefore that aid isnt working. https://www.ippr.org/publications/understanding-public-attitudes-to-aid-and-development …
author: wdjstraw

text: It was a great day - covering close races in Barking, Bermondsey & Bethnal Green as I recall. And amazing watching you editing & uploading the films from the backseat of my car!
author: wdjstraw

text: Terrible news. Honda has consistently warned of the dangers of leaving the customs union or a no deal Brexit.
author: wdjstraw

text: I agree with that. But he would have said the same in the early 80s with regard to the late 40s / late 60s.
author: wdjstraw

text: I still believe that Labour is the best route to social justice in Britain. My advice over many months to friends considering leaving has been to stay and fight. I won’t criticise those who have been driven to the door but I’m going nowhere.
author: wdjstraw

text: Thank you
author: wdjstraw

text: We slogged our guts out, Tim, in the most trying & testing of circumstances - with a Tory leader who only engaged with 4 months to go & a Lab leader who didn’t engage at all. Anyone interested in a new campaign shld seek to learn the good, bad & ugly from before not hurl insults
author: wdjstraw

text: Fantastic to see my friend @MarshadeCordova call for a #PeoplesVote. She is absolutely right that the public deserve better than the invidious choice of May’s Bad Deal or crashing out with No Deal
author: wdjstraw

text: This is the Britain you’ve created @michaelgove @BorisJohnson @Jacob_Rees_Mogg - reality not a fear.
author: wdjstraw

text: A proper focus on clear vision must be part of the solution. Too many countries do not require an eye test to get a license. @ClearlyWorld
author: wdjstraw

text: Superb from ⁦@NickCohen4⁩ “Intellectually, their Brexit was an empty idea. But electorally, allowing millions to believe that the impossible was possible was perfect post-rational politics.”
author: wdjstraw

text: Today’s headlines: Brexit already costing £17bn per year as thousands of firms plan mass exodus if No Deal takes place. Surely the time has come for #PeoplesVote
author: wdjstraw

text: Get in! What a performance against the league’s form team.
author: wdjstraw

text: I agree. But Corbyn works in moral certainties. He could have gained the high ground if he’d set out his demands in a meeting.
author: wdjstraw

text: I’m not a Labour MP. But share your frustration. Lab shld now push for a #PeopleVote which is members’ policy. If it did so there would be enough votes in Parl to get it through.
author: wdjstraw

text: Daft of Corbyn not to meet May. He should insist on red lines incl taking no deal off the table, a permanent customs union & a #peoplesvote - all consistent with Lab policy & all unlikely to be met by May giving him moral high ground.
author: wdjstraw

text: So much for “TARP” effect & market turmoil. Pound rose sharply after May’s massive defeat. #BrexitVote
author: wdjstraw

text: Nice theory. But not true. We spent on FB right up until polls closed on June 23.
author: wdjstraw

text: Thank you
author: wdjstraw

text: #winning
author: wdjstraw

text: You old charmer. Maybe we need to find a campaign to unite us.
author: wdjstraw

text: Thanks Zander
author: wdjstraw

text: If there is a #PeoplesVote it’s vital that we learn the right lessons from #BrexitUncivilWar. My take on the frustrations & failings of the Remain campaign https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2019/jan/08/i-was-in-remain-campaign-win-peoples-vote-brexit-the-uncivil-war …
author: wdjstraw

text: They very nearly did! Outstanding performance from @rovers & now the chance to win at Ewood. #FACupThirdRound
author: wdjstraw

text: Thanks. Not sure I see the diff since Owen also writes about “Remain & Reform” but I certainly agree that we need to address the domestic causes of Brexit too. What we must avoid is the 2016 mistake of running an entirely separate “Labour In” campaign.
author: wdjstraw

text: Not seen Owen’s piece & can’t find. Do u have a link? Key thing is (1) ensure Remain is not status quo & (2) get Labour in the campaign to make progressive arguments & avoid it being another Blue on Blue clusterf***
author: wdjstraw

text:
Brilliant by @zoesqwilliams: Labour pushing for Remain & Reform can mean a Europe of:
 rising citizens rights
 international trade unionism
 a green new deal
 solidarity with migrants
 a renewed focus on peace 
https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2018/dec/23/labour-remain-jeremy-corbyn-brexit … #PeoplesVote
author: wdjstraw

text: So saddened to hear of Paddy Ashdown’s passing. He exemplified a kinder, gentler politics and was an absolute pleasure to work with on Remain and, more recently, @ClearlyWorld - always bringing good humour along with his passion & principle.
author: wdjstraw

text: UK will fall from 5th to 7th largest economy in 2019 due to weak pound & low growth  #thanksBrexit
author: wdjstraw

text: There is criticism for all sides in Ivan Rogers’ brilliant lecture on “9 lessons from Brexit”. But this on No Deal is most sobering of all - especially the final para. https://news.liverpool.ac.uk/2018/12/13/full-speech-sir-ivan-rogers-on-brexit/ …
author: wdjstraw

text: #PeoplesVote
author: wdjstraw

text: Bercow
author: wdjstraw

text:
***Theresa May U-Turns Latest***
Last week: "No. I dont think there should be another referendum"
This week: ?
author: wdjstraw

text: I dont think the argument will ever end. Just as joining in '73 didnt end a 'thousand years of history' as Gaitskell had it.
author: wdjstraw
